response_plan: The response to the electrical fire at Calle San Francisco, CÃ¡diz, Spain involves deploying Trucks 1 and 3, which are equipped with Carbon Dioxide (CO2) Extinguishers, Dry Chemical Extinguishers, Clean Agent Extinguishers, and Fire-Resistant Blankets. These trucks will follow the planned routes to reach the fire scene efficiently.
action_details: Upon arrival, firefighters will use the extinguishing agents suitable for electrical fires, while also utilizing fire-resistant blankets for protecting people from flames during rescue operations. The team will allocate 4 firefighters for rescue and medical assistance, ensuring all injured individuals receive timely care. Additionally, thermal imaging cameras will be used to identify hot spots and locate anyone trapped inside. Ventilation fans and smoke removal equipment will improve visibility and reduce respiratory hazards, creating a safer environment for both firefighters and those being rescued.
